summary: This document is a Deutsche Bank alert report regarding Jeffrey Edward Epstein, highlighting his status as a registered sex offender and detailing various legal issues and convictions related to sexual offenses and fraud. It includes multiple references to his criminal history, including charges and convictions for soliciting prostitution and other illegal activities. This document contains a series of alerts from Deutsche Bank regarding Jeffrey Epstein, highlighting various media articles related to his legal issues and allegations of sexual misconduct. The alerts indicate a critical risk priority associated with Epstein, referencing multiple lawsuits and media coverage of his activities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is identified as a billionaire and registered sex offender with a history of soliciting prostitution and sexual offenses against minors. He has been involved in numerous legal cases and settlements related to these charges.

events.title: Conviction for Soliciting Minors
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting a minor for prostitution and was convicted, serving 13 months in jail.

events.title: Served Jail Time
events.description: Epstein served 12 months for a state charge of prostitution solicitation and registered as a sex offender.

events.title: Plea Deal
events.description: Epstein pleaded guilty to lesser state charges rather than federal charges of sexually assaulting dozens of underage girls.

events.title: Conviction for Postal Fraud
events.description: Epstein was convicted of postal fraud for stealing his neighbor's mail.

events.title: Conviction for Postal Larceny
events.description: Epstein was convicted of postal larceny and theft.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is a registered sex offender since 2008 after pleading guilty to soliciting prostitution.
By 2011, 40 underage girls had come forward with allegations of sexual assault against Epstein.
Epstein has made 17 out-of-court settlements related to sexual offenses.
He served 12 months for a state charge of prostitution solicitation in 2017.
Epstein was convicted of postal fraud and theft in 2006.
Jeffrey Epstein is under critical monitoring by Deutsche Bank due to his legal issues.
Numerous media articles are referenced, detailing Epstein's connections to underage girls and various lawsuits.
The document highlights Epstein's involvement in multiple legal cases, including allegations of sexual abuse and trafficking.
Epstein's birth date is noted as January 20, 1953.
The document includes references to various media outlets reporting on Epstein's activities and legal challenges.
